result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn T Ice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Indecent or Otherwise Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Indecent or Otherwise Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: AS TO COUNTS ONE, TWO, THREE, FOUR AND FIVE, EACH COUNT:  to be served consecutive to one another.
Court stayed all five sentences,  placed defendant on probation for 28 months concurrent.

miscConds.notes:
No DNA sample required.  Pay DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC during the period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
No Contact with victims M.A.K., T.A.S., K.R.D., T.J.S., C.V.E., AND B.D.

Participate in any course/counseling treatment as determined by the probation agent.
Must complete a sex offender counseling and treatment as deemed by the probation agent.

timeConds.notes: Must complete 10 hours of community service for a nonprofit organization on each count for a total of 50 hours.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, each count to be served consecutively to one another; with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, each count to be served consecutively to one another; with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, each count to be served consecutively to one another; with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 4:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, each count to be served consecutively to one another; with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 5:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, each count to be served consecutively to one another; with credit for 0 days time served.

COURT STAYED ALL 5 SENTENCES and placed defendant on probation for 28 MONTHS concurrent.

 The conditions of PROBATION are as follows: 

- No Contact with victims: MAK, TAS, KRD,TJS, CVE, and BD.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections during the period of probation.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Pay DNA surcharge. No DNA sample required.
-The defendant is to participate in any course/counseling treatment as determined by the probation agent. 
-Defendant must complete sex offender counseling and treatment as deemed by the probation agent. 
-Defendant must complete 10 hours of community service for a non-profit organizatio, on each count for a total of 50 hours.

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Atty Smith is requesting that the time for sentencing on 4-29-2016 be changed to 11am to accommodate the defendant's employment.

Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing arguments are begun.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  The court requires additional information as to where victims are residing at this time before it can render a proper sentence.  Case is adjourned to 4-29-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Letters on behalf of defendant filed by Atty Smith

Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 6.
Pursuant to negotiations, counts 2, 4, and 5 are amended to DISORDERLY CONDUCT, class B misdemeanors, 947.01(1).  AS to counts 1,2,3,4,5:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgments of conviction entered.  Counts 6 and 7 are ordered dismissed and read in.
Victim notification is required.  Case is adjourned to 4-20-2016 at 8:15 for sentencing.  Branch 38 will retain case.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Case remains in trial posture.  State informs parties, they have another trial scheduled on the same date.  Case is adjourned for Jury Trial on 4/6/2016

Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy court clerk: LMS.

State's request for an adjournment of the 1/13/2016 jury trial date due to essential witness unavailability, is granted by the court.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO ADJOURN, received and filed. lms

Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense motion to adjourned is granted by the courts with no objection from State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Received and filed, MOTION TO ADJOURN JURY TRIAL.  lms

Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  
Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Parties advised that Branch 06 is currently in jury trial and spin court unlikely as the court is already seeking a spin court for another trial (speedy).  Adjourned date selected with the parties.  No final pretrial necessary per the parties (firm trial).  

  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Case remains set for jury trial.  States witnesses subpoenaed, defense to serve theirs.  No unusual motions or jury instructions to be filed.  All discovery and statements recieved.  Today is the last day court will accept plea negotiations.  Case is adjourned for jury trial in branch 6 on 09/30/2015.

Defendant Shawn T Ice in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Final pre-trial.  State's motion to adjourn jury trial heard and granted by the Court.  No objection from defense.  Jury trial date of 7-13-15 vacated at this time.   All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
